SENT.plain: Lysozyme (LZM) was identified in ulcerative colitis in granulocytes, monocytes, and macrophages of the intestinal lamina propria
In contrast with findings in normal colon or rectum, in ulcerative colitis LZM was also detected in some mucosal crypt cells and metaplastic Paneth cells
In both ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease LZM was present in inflammatory cells of crypt abscesses
In Crohn's disease intense LZM staining was seen in epitheloid cell granulomas
The present observations permit one explanation for the raised concentration of serum-LZM in patients with ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease
